text: Werner Theodor Otto Forßmann (29 August 1904 – 1 June 1979) was a German physician. He was the winner of the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1956. Forssmann studied the active principles and discovered cardiac catheterization. Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:Scientists from Berlin Category:1904 births Category:1979 deaths Category:German Nobel Prize winners
title: Werner Forssmann
